intro: Nematanthus striatus, commonly known as the velvet plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in a dense, fuzzy texture that gives the plant its common name. The flowers, which come in shades of red, orange, and yellow, are often borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. This plant is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
